name: places/ChIJg4gMMaVZwokR7E0T66JOCNU
formattedAddress: 164 W 25th St #3, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 164 W 25th St #3, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: This school offers classes in the Israeli martial art, Krav Maga, for students of all ages.

originalText.text:
A few years ago, my gym membership lapsed and I had gotten a little soft.  A friend who worked in the Columbus Circle area mentioned that she wanted to try Krav Maga.  We took an introductory class at the Krav Maga Federation (then located at John Jay College).  I was sore for days after that.  Life got busy and I couldn't commit to a regular workout schedule until several months later.  When I found the time, I joined the KMF.

It's hard to believe that it's been more than 5 years since I first stepped on the mat at John Jay College.  Since then, Rhon Mizrachi has opened his own school in Chelsea and has greatly expanded his class schedule.  In addition to regular classes, there are weapons and groundwork classes, seminars and workshops.  There is even a kids program - and you can bet that my daughter will be given the opportunity to train there as soon as she's old enough!

Ever since I started training in Krav Maga, I've told everyone who will listen about what it means to me and what it has done for me.  I've invited numerous people to try classes and they have all been impressed.  I know that some women feel intimidated by martial arts, but there's no need for that here.  When you walk in the door at KMF, you aren't reduced to your demographics.  You aren't a man or woman, gay or straight, black or white, old or young or anything else I've failed to mention - you are simply a person who wants to learn to save your own life.  At KMF, you can learn ways to do that in the face of a violent attack.  If you are committed to being respectful of the tradition, the art, the instructors, the school and your fellow students, you are welcome here.

I hope to see you on the mat.

originalText.text:
I found out about Krav Maga Federation through a friend‚Äôs constant Facebook postings about how great it was but at the time I was doing a pretty intense workout 6 days a week and while it sounded cool it did not seem necessary.  The place where I was working out involved a good deal of us yelling which I cannot do since my voice only goes so loud.  After a particularly unsuccessful day of yelling my instructor who was concerned, asked me what I would do if I was being mugged or otherwise attacked if I can‚Äôt scream for help. That day I asked my friend to take me with him to his next Krav Maga class.

That was 10 months ago and ever since then I have attended every single class I possibly can.  I have pretty much become a permanent fixture at the school.

Because of Rhon Mizrachi I have found a strength and confidence I don‚Äôt remember ever feeling before.  He takes such a great deal of pride in the art and it shows not only in the way he is with his students but in how well he has taught his instructors to teach others.

During the hour class the instructors are tough but let's face it, in a way they are taking on the huge responsibility of getting us out alive if it came down to a life or death situation.  They are not promising that we will come out completely unharmed if we got into a fight, in fact they pretty much guarantee we would get hurt (even the most seasoned fighters don't come out unscathed) but they are teaching us how to inflict the most damage possible on our attacker while at the same time taking as little impact on ourselves.

As tough as they are on the mat, they are also extremely kind, approachable, always willing to answer a question, help correct your form or show you that one specific move for the millionth time (and I say that from personal experience).

Then there is Eve, the woman who runs the show.  I can be having a particularly tough class, she will pop her head in for one reason or another and she will smile at me as if she instinctively knows (which she probably does being that she has gone through it all, is now a green belt and still training) and I am immediately able to get my head right back into my training.

I would highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to feel safer and that if ever attacked they would ultimately end up feeling that they were the one in control of the situation.

originalText.text: This is the best Krav Maga school in the New York, maybe the US. Impressively Rhon, whose school is named after, teaches many of the classes himself. Having the founder of a martial arts school who teaches white belts and black belts alike is unusual. Rhon is an artist of his craft and teaches it with care and detail.   Lastly, the other instructors; David, Erik, Kel, Adam, and Alon are all high-level belts, all taught by Rhon, and are too excellent instructors.  They consistently teach to high standards. I feel lucky to have access to this, hardcore, no-nonsense,  Krav mega school, honestly.

originalText.text: Having practiced at the school for over 8 years, I can attest to the great professionalism and knowledge of all the instructors. Master instructor Rhon Mizrachi is a walking encyclopedia on the art of Krav Maga and fighting. His wealth of knowledge and experience is unparalleled. You can't find a better place to learn how to protect your own life.
